metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17566 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache Batik is vulnerable to server-side request forgery, caused by improper input validation by the "xlink:href" attributes. By using a specially-crafted argument, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the underlying server to make arbitrary GET requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbatik-java - 1.10-2~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: batik package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10-2~18.04.1').
